dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Don’t know, who were you expecting?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Guards, servants, courtiers -- this is a castle, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Glinda, she is a Witch -- anda Witch-witch needs no one.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Independent-minded, is she? I like that in a woman.

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: (stops, turns) But I’m telling you she’s not a woman -- she’s a Witch.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you let me be the judge of that?  54. -- with a wolfish grin -- and Kala rolls his eyes -- they continue into the castle -- and in moments we arrive in: INT. GLINDA’S PRIVATE CHAMBER Very long, very high, many-windowed -- French doors leadi out to a balcony -- and, as with the rest of the castle, there’s no one to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You gonna let her know we’re here?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: No need! And he points -- through the open French doors -- and 0z looks and sees, in the distance, coming towards us -- A MAGIC BUBBLE... looks like a big opalescent bubble of s Oz glances at Kala -- Kala just grins -- and the Bubble k wafting towards us, settles down onto the balcony -- the Bubble vanishes, and there she is...

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: And she is, in the words of Joseph Campbell: “The paragon all paragons of beauty, the reply to all desire... the incarnation of the promise of perfection.” She steps into the room -- has the bearing of a Pirate Queen.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: So. You're the Wizard everyone's talking about. I’m Glinda. And Oz just shakes his head -- sounds absolutely awestruc

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: No... I know who you are: You’re Venus and Aphrodite, Ishtar and Isis, you’re Helen and Cleopatra, Ophelia and Juliet. You are the reason men write poetry. You are why men fight wars. And Glinda smiles -- dryly --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Yes, Kala told me how fond you were of words. He also said he wasn’t sure if you really are a Wizard.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: He did, did he?  55. -- scowling at Kala, who nods enthusiastically --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: So, then -- are you?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: A Wizard? Guess that all depends on how you define the term. Can I turn water into wine, dross into gold? No. Nor can I make mountains tremble or part the Seven Seas. However... He reaches towards Kala -- seems to pluck that Dainty Chi Egg right out of the Monkey's ear.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I can at times Astound and Amaze. (makes the Egg disappear) Illusion’s my game.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Illusion as in: Not real.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Madame, you cut me to the quick.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Evanora, I understand, wanted to do even worse than that --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: That she did --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But you got away... which leads me to believe: Even if you’re not a Wizard, you are certainly resourceful -- and therefore, perhaps, useful.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (scowls) What’re you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Good People of Oz have been waiting for a Wizard to come and free them from Evanora’s Evil Rule. And even if you’re not that Wizard, right now you’re the only Wizard I've got... She walks out onto the balcony.  56.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The only Wizard they've got. Oz looks puzzled -- Glinda gestures: Come look. EXT. GLINDA’S CASTLE BALCONY Oz steps out, and sees: A SEA OF PEOPLE -- hundreds, maybe thousands of them -- streaming towards the castle from every direction.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Who in the Devil are they?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Good People of the South. They’ve come to see the Great Wizard who’s going to lead them against the Sisters and their Savage Army. Oz gapes at her -- then stares out at the in-coming flood and they're coming from different cities, different clans different tribes -- we go in closer and see: CUTTENCLIP SOLDIERS -- who, from the front, look very impressive -- marching smartly, rifles on their shoulders dressed like Beefeater Guards... HAMMERHEADS, whom we’ve already met... DAINTY CHINA SOLDIERS AND FARMERS -- their glazed china clothes and bodies shining in the sun... A PHALANX OF FUDDLES -- fairly normal-looking people except the thick haphazard puzzle-piece lines on their faces and bodies and clothes...and lastly: THE STERLING INHABITANTS UTENSIA -- who are walking kitchen utensils: KNIVES and FORKS and CLEAVERS and SCISSORS and SPOONS -- all with ey and arms and legs -- the Scissors en pointe like ballerin And when the Good People of the South look up and see Oz, TREMENDOUS CHEER goes up -- Oz feels obliged to wave back hem -- says to Glinda, through a fixed smile --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: All these people... they want me to lead them into battle?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: They want the Land of Oz to be free.  57.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Okay, look -- you need a Wizard, I'll be a Wizard -- but I’m not a Warlord. What you need is someone with brains and heart and courage --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: We need you.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Why? Why can’t you do it? Theodora told me you were the most powerful Sorceress of all.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But there are two Wicked Sisters, and if I try to fight them alone they might well destroy me -- and if I should die, Hope and Dreams would die here in the Land of Oz -- would die for a thousand years. (adamant ) No -- it has to be you.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: And what if I say no?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Then I’d be very disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be the first.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: And I would banish you forever from Quadling Country.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Throwing me to the tender mercies of the Wicked Sisters, you mean. (then) And you call yourself a Good Witch.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: A Good Witch is still a Witch, and a Witch wants what she wants -- and I want these people to be free. A beat -- then Oz smiles -- craftily -- like something sh just said hit a chord with him.  58.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Back where I come from, nothing's free -- so tell you what I’m gonna do. I’m gonna go down there and have a little look-see at what you're giving me to work with -- then you and I are gonna have a little parlez-vous... so now, if you'll excuse me... He moves past her, climbs over the railing and climbs dow the trellis which goes from the balcony to the ground. Glinda signals to Kala -- Kala flaps down to join Oz as - QZ REVIEWS THE TROOPS -- Kala trailing behind him like a Master Sergeant. And to call this a Highly Irregular Army to put it mildly. 0Oz first stops in front of: THE HAMMERHEADS -- a lot more of them than there were bef -- all looking as surly as an armless gang of Dead End Ki or card-carrying members of the Lollipop Guild.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I've already seen these boys in action -- a good group to have if you get into a tussle. The Hammerheads nod to each other -- still scowling, but satisfied -- and Oz moves on to: THE DAINTY CHINA SOLDIERS AND FARMERS -- all as smooth an glossy and apple-cheeked as Dresden figurines.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Very pretty -- but can they fight? Kala discreetly shakes a no. Next up: THE FUDDLES -- who all stiffen their spines and try to lo stalwart and strong for Oz -- who can’t help but stare at thick jigsaw lines which pattern each of their bodies and faces like scars. Their leader is named FARNSWORTH --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: What happened to you people?

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: What happened? Nothing happened -- we were born like this.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I see.  59.

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: Do you? Most people find us rather... puzzling.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Can you fight?

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: We love to fight, sir -- provided, of course, that nothing untoward or unexpected occurs -- you know: Loud noises, sudden attacks -- anything that would get us frightened or surprised. The thing is, sir, we Fuddles have a tendency of sometimes falling all to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Falling all to --? And just like that: THE FUDDLE FALLS TO PIECES -- just collapses in a jigsaw heap -- there’s part of his face he half his shoulder there, the crook of an elbow next to th

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (absolutely flabbergasted) Did he just --? He did, he just...

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t concern yourself, sir -- I’m quite all right! Oz looks closer: a puzzle piece of Farnsworth’s MOUTH is moving -- under another piece which features a BLINKING E

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: See? -- I'll have myself back together in no time. He’s already piecing himself back together.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Does it hurt when you do that?

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: Not at all, sir. Coming apart at the seams is actually quite relaxing -- relieves a lot of stress, as you can imagine. Oz looks at Kala, then moves on to:  60. THE CUTTENCLIP SOLDIERS -- and there seem to be thousands them -- all almost identical in their military finery, in perfect lines and perfect rows -- and Oz sounds pleased -

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Ah, here we go! Now these men look like soldiers! These men --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s so happy he claps one of the Soldiers on the shoulde and the Cuttenclip’s torso RIPS almost in two! And this s startles Oz that suddenly he SNEEZES -- and dozens of the Cuttenclips go flutter-flying back into one another as th they just got hit with a bomb-blast!

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Are these men made of... paper?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Oh yes -- magic paper -- a little old lady, she makes them! -- she’s very-very jolly, very sweet --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (glaring up at Glinda) But they’re paper! You're giving me Paper Soldiers? He moves on to the Utensils -- who look hard and honed --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Now we're talking... yes... I reckon these Sterling Citizens could kill a Savage or two!

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: No, they cannot.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: They are enchanted -- and anything enchanted cannot kill. And this knocks 0z completely for a loop.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Can I... speak to you a moment? And he clambers back up the trellis, heatedly gestures fo Glinda to join him back in --  61. INT. GLINDA’S PRIVATE CHAMBER

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You're telling me that none of these People can kill?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: No one born here in Oz can kill... except Witches -- and Wizards --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: And the Sisters’ Savage Army?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Savages are not from here... nor are they enchanted.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: So you're saying: They can kill. But the Good People of Oz --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Cannot.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You want me to lead an Army that can’t kill.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: If this were easy, we wouldn’t need a Wizard, would we?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (sly as hell) That's right... and, like you said, right now I’m the only Wizard you've got. So what I want to know is: What’s in it for me?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Excuse me? -- and now Oz is in his element -- he’s seen an angle her and he’s working it --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: What’d you think, you were dealing with some babe in the woods here, all dewy-eyed and wet behind the ears? No, and the way I see it: Banish me and you've got nothing -- they've got nothing -- so what I wanna know is: I do this for you, and what do I get out of it?  62.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: (ice) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: If I’m gonna risk my neck I wanna be rewarded. Which means: If, in the highly unlikely event we somehow manage to defeat the Wicked Sisters and their Savage Horde, as soon as we march into the Emerald City I wanna go straight to that room Evanora took me to and I wanna load up with all the gold and jewels and gemstones I can carry, then I wanna get out of this cockamamie country and go somewhere where Monkeys don’t fly and Witches aren’t trying to kill me and everyone else isn’t looking to me like I’m the Answer to questions that have nothing to do with me! (then, rhapsodically) I just wanna go where the rich people go... I wanna walk through rooms of soft carpet, I wanna sleep in beds of eiderdown, I wanna drink champagne out of cut crystal and I wanna live in a house high on a hill -- and when I pass by people on the street in my gilded carriage I want them to turn to each other and say: There goes somebody. -- seeing it in his mind’s eye -- liking what he’s seeing

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Very well then. That would be a small price to pay for the freedom of my people.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Then it sounds like you and me have got ourselves a deal. He grins, steps past her, back onto -- EXT. GLINDA’S BALCONY Where again he looks out over the crowd again -- at their upturned faces -- seeing their hope and their faith, then  63.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: And wouldn’t it be funny... if you turned out to be the man they imagine you to be...? (he snaps a look at her) ... The man you’ve always dreamed of being? He stares -- she struck a nerve -- it’s like she looked r through him -- and she smiles -- knowingly -- he looks ba out at the Sea of People -- as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evanora’s gazing into her CRYSTAL BALL -- Theodora comes

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Ah. There you are. Come see: I was right. SEEING: OZ AND GLINDA -- IN THE CRYSTAL BALL -- still out on Glinda’s Castle Balcony -- the huge crowd still below.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Your Wizard and Glinda are now together. He has chosen... soon you must too... She turns her gaze on Theodora -- Theodora tries to keep expression out of her face -- but still...

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: It hurts, doesn’t it -- I can see it, yes: it pains your heart... -- her words like a drip-drip-drip of slow poison --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: To know he used you... to know he played you for a fool... he made you believe, didn’t he? -- and do you still?... what do you think, that someday he'll be coming back for you, ask you to be his Lady Love and Queen? (a smile) Don’t worry, my pretty, he will be coming back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of hope -- but then the Diamond Dagger suddenly appears in Evanora’s hand --  64.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: .-. But not to ask you for your hand -- he'll be coming to chop off your head! And Theodora -- deeply stung -- bolts from the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running -- actually seems to be fighting back tears, and

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: No -- No! -- hands to her face now, over her eyes -- and she stumbl

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Don’t! Do not! Stop! She wails -- in pain -- blindly keeps moving -- staggerin INT. THEODORA’S ROOM She stumbles in -- one hand still across her face -- feel her way across the room to the Mirror on the Wall. She stands in front of it, removes her hand, and we see: THEODORA -- IN THE MIRROR -- and she has been crying -- s is: a single tear leaking from each eye -- and both those tears are leaving burn-lines on her face -- smoke rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodora -- breathing hard -- berating herself --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Stupid. So stupid. Serves you right. She dabs at her eyes, then sees: 0Z’S MUSIC BOX -- and wi a quick backhand swipe: SHE KNOCKS THE MUSIC BOX SMASHING THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MUNCHKIN MAID hears the crash, comes hurrying in. Theod resumes staring into the Mirror, just says --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Get _a broom. EXT. GLINDA’S CASTLE - NIGHT The crystal spires against a backdrop of a zillion stars.  65.

dialogues.speaker: OZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And what’s this here, to the east of the Emerald City? INT. GLINDA’S LIBRARY A LAND MAP OF OZ -- spread out on a low table in front of blazing fireplace, the room’s only light -- 0Z AND GLINDA separate chairs, shadows fluid on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Those are the Deadly Poppy Fields. Steer well clear of them -- they can put you to sleep forever.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Right now eternal rest doesn’t sound too bad. He yawns, picks up his goblet of wine -- then leans back, rubs his face -- done for the night. Glinda has to ask:

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: So what do you think? You think this is going to work?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: C’mon, what’re you worried about? This is gonna be child's play -- a walk in the park. (another big yawn) I mean, what’s the big deal? All I've gotta do is lead a rag-tag bunch of Irregulars who can’t fight and can't kill against an Army of Murderous Savages who not only can fight and can kill but, I’m told, actually quite enjoy it --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: -- Yes they do --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: And if somehow, against all odds, we manage to make our way past the Heathen Horde, then all we'll be facing are two Wicked Witches who not only have some serious magic literally at their fingertips, but who, no doubt, are eager to visit the tortures of Torquemada on my mind, body and person! (yawns, rubs his eyes) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OZ (cont'd) Like I said: Child’s play. What could be easier?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But that’s what a Wizard does... he does things everyone knows can’t be done. And 0z gives her a long, long look -- he so wants to tell the truth -- instead, he drains his goblet, returns his t gaze to the flames -- and, almost unconsciously, he takes that Gold Coin from his pocket, rolls it through his fing

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Y'know, back where I come from there’s a Wizard by the name of Thomas Alva Edison -- the Wizard of Menlo Park. I once traveled three hundred miles just to meet him -- even got to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Is he a Good Wizard?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: No: he is a Great Wizard -- he is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a man who made a difference. You know what he did? He invented the electric light... and the phonograph... and a camera that lets you take moving pictures.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Pictures that move...?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (eyes closing) A prime example of good old American Know-how and Ingenuity. That’s all it is -- all you need... good old American Know-how and... Ingenuity... He’s asleep. The Gold Coin drops to the floor. Glinda rises, takes the goblet from his hand, covers him with a blanket, places the Gold Coin back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Sleep well, Wizard. And dream of Victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GLINDA’S LIBRARY - LATER THAT NIGHT Oz suddenly wakes up -- has his Eureka Moment.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I’ve got it. He flings off the blanket, jumps out of the chair, rummag around the room -- finds what he’s looking for: SHEETS OF PAPER AND A QUILL-TIP PEN -- and immediately, feverishly, he gets to work -- sketching, drawing -- designing -- and off the scratching of his pen we jump to INT. GLINDA’S PRIVATE CHAMBER —- MORNING Glinda’s here with Kala -- as Oz bursts in, all excited, waving his sketches in the air.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I’ve got it! I know how we can beat them! What I have in mind is an historic extravaganza of Olympian proportions! Using good old American Know-How and Ingenuity, smoke and mirrors, Son et Lumiere, I intend to create an illusion of such magnificent magnificence that it will boggle the mind and bedazzle the senses! It will, in other words, send the Sisters and their Savage Army into such paroxysms of Awe and Wonder that they will flee the Emerald City like rats from a burning barn! (then, much quieter) And the one tiny little potential hiccup is... I have no technical expertise whatsoever and, therefore, no way of turning these renderings into reality.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Then you must speak to the Elves at Smith & Tinkers. They should be able to help you. Kala nods -- yes-yes -- and we go --  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Santa’s Workshop without the snow -- and the E look a lot like Santa’s Helpers. Oz is here with Kala. TW MASTER ELVES are leafing through Oz’s drawings...

dialogues.speaker: MASTER ELF
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t be a problem. When do you need these by?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Quick as you can.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER ELF
dialogues.text: Come back day after tomorrow. Not before lunch. The Master Elves turn and walk away -- already discussing between themselves who’s going to be doing what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oz looks up at the sky -- and has a thought.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: That fog the other night -- you said that was Glinda’s doing? Can she do that whenever she wants?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Oh yes -- that and more.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: She’s a heckuva woman, isn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: (with a scowl) But I told you, she’s not a woman.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, I know -- got it -- she’s a Witch. IN. GLINDA’S LIBRARY - LATER THAT DAY Oz is giving the various CLAN LEADERS their marching orde He gestures to some of the Scissor People, and tells the old, strangely girlish, apple-cheeked MISS CUTTENCLIP --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: They’1l help you -- just tell ‘em what to do and how to do it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OZ (cont'd) (then, to everyone) Any questions? THE DAINTY CHINA MAYOR stands and gives Oz a snappy salut

dialogues.speaker: DAINTY CHINA MAYOR
dialogues.text: Begging pardon, sir. But the China People, we want to contribute -- we want to fight! The other CHINA PEOPLE present nod in agreement. Oz gets comes over and SHAKES THE MAYOR’S HAND.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: That's very valiant of you -- most laudable -- and I appreciate the sentiment, believe me -- but here’s the thing... With a quick twist of the wrist, OZ SNAPS OFF THE MAN’S A

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: See, that’s a problem. (hands the man his arm, then, to the others) Alright, let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Cuttenclip and dozens of magic Scissors are cutting hundreds of Paper Soldiers... China People are painting t Soldiers in martial colors the Fuddles are on the Champ d Mars, in military rows, and when Farnsworth Fuddle shouts command the Fuddles in unison all fall to pieces... the Hammerheads are practicing their head-butting skills... a Oz is overseeing everything -- seems more energized than we've ever seen him. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GLINDA’S LIBRARY - EVENING Oz is sitting down with Glinda and Kala.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I’m guessing you have friends inside the Emerald City -- friends you can trust.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: We do. How many do you need?  70.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: However many the Elves need to set things up. Now...

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: (interrupts) You're enjoying this, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Enjoying it?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (a beat) Can you also tell I’m terrified?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: of?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: All of it. I mean... for the first time in my life people are counting on me -- they’re relying on me --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: And is that so terrible?

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: It is if we fail.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: We won't.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: But if we do, you said it yourself: It would mean the Death of Hope and Dreams here in the Land of Oz.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Then we'll just have to make sure that doesn’t happen, won’t we? Another pause, then -- something that’s been bothering hi

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: And when we get to the Emerald City... I was wondering... what about Theodora?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: What about her?  71.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You think there’s, well, any chance she might join us? I just thought... there’s still some good in her.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Yes there is -- but I’m afraid that will soon be gone. (gently) Theodora’s doomed. She’s tried to resist her sister and the wickedness within her for the longest time -- but that time, I think, is about to run out... and even you can’t save her.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER ELF
dialogues.text: And on this, you’ll notice, we made a few modifications. Oz is examining one of the completed contraptions. Kala’s here with him.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER ELF
dialogues.text: We thought if you added a few more of these -- here, here, and here -- instead of this it should look more like that, rounded instead of flat. Oz studies the schematics -- then looks up.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You're a genius. A genius on par with the Great Edison himself!

dialogues.speaker: MASTER ELF
dialogues.text: Try telling that to my wife. (moves to next table) Now over here we've got...

dialogues.speaker: OZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My father died a broken man... INT. GLINDA’S LIBRARY - THAT NIGHT FLAMES IN THE FIREPLACE. OZ AND GLINDA -- alone.  72.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: He was a preacher, who went from dusty town to dusty town selling dreams of a better life and a better world -- but this world and this life beat him down to next to nothing, and even as a child I promised myself that was not gonna happen to me. I might’ve come from the dirt but I always believed my future was in the stars. (looks over at her) And I believe that future is now -- I can feel it -- my whole life’s been leading up to this.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: I believe that too. I believe this is your Destiny. (beat) And I believe in you, Wizard. He gazes at her for quite a while, then, finally...

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You_know I’m not a Wizard. Of course she does. She reaches over, takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But you are a good man -- and sometimes that’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Glinda... She shakes her head, tells him --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Get some rest. Tomorrow the future begins. EXT. GLINDA’S CASTLE - NEXT MORNING 0Z'S ARMY is here in force -- flags and standards flappin the breeze -- UTENSILS... HAMMERHEADS... PAPER SOLDIERS.. FUDDLES -- ready to march. DAINTY CHINA PEOPLE are here t wave their heroes off -- some of the DAINTY CHINA GIRLS s caught up in the moment they’re actually CRYING SOLID DAI CHINA TEARS -- which fall like pebbles to the ground -- o shatter into powder.  73. KALA helps Glinda onto a pure white steed. A FOOTMAN lead second horse to Oz -- who can’t help but notice that the horse’s coat is an ever-changing kaleidoscope of color.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: What kind of horse is this?

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN
dialogues.text: Why it’s a Horse of a Different Color, sir.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Of course it is. Oz mounts, then wheels and gives his troops his best Henr

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: My friends! Back where I come from we have a saying: Ad astra per aspera -- it’s the motto of the Great State of Kansas and in Wizard- speak it means: “To the stars, through difficulties.” We also say: E Pluribus Unum: “Out of many, one.” And that is us today: One people -- one army -- and, together, we shall reach the stars! Are you with me! (the Army roars back a resounding YES!) Are you with me! A louder YES! -- then, to Glinda, under his breath --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: This is your last chance to talk me out of this. Glinda just smiles -- then shouts out to the troops:

dialogues.speaker: TO OZ AND THE EMERALD CITY
dialogues.text: The Army starts to march -- the China People wave and wee and hurrah -- and we PULL BACK and UP and we go -- INT. THRONE ROOM - EVANORA’S PALACE The Wicked Sisters are SEEING 0Z'S ARMY IN THE CRYSTAL.  74.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: And so they march. Soon there will be no more sand in the hourglass... soon you must decide... Theodora turns to her -- fretful -- torn -- and we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oz‘s Army approaches the border -- everything on the othe side wavy, mirage-like -- then Glinda sweeps an arm, and SHIMMERING WALL DISAPPEARS -- Central Oz is now clear as bell. Oz himself looks skyward.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Nice day we’re having... but I’m told the weather around here can change just like that. -- snapping his fingers -- then Glinda smiles --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Actually it’s more like this... And she slowly raises her arms, calling forth:

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS SNOWSTORM
dialogues.text: A WALL OF WHITE comes ROARING in out of nowhere and engul the whole of Oz’s Army in a HOWLING BLIZZARD -- FROM ABOVE WE SEE THE STORM spreading over them -- spread wide -- spreading miles in every direction -- wide enough that it would be impossible to pinpoint the Army’s locati and the strangest thing is... WITH THE ARMY -- INSIDE THE STORM -- the weather here is. perfectly calm. It’s like they’re in the eye of a wintry hurricane -- in the middle of a parted Red Sea -- with towering clouds VORTEXING above and all around them -- a swirling ceiling, whirling walls -- but down here at grou level, there’s only the slightest breeze...

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You, m’lady, are magnificent. (then, to the troops) Abracadabra, ad astra per aspera and E Pluribus Unum! And as the Army moves forward -- THE CALM EYE OF THE STOR MOVES WITH THEM...  75.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And still you hesitate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SISTERS -- gazing into the Crystal -- seeing the Stor

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: What’s it going to take, Sister? Do you intend to wait until they’re inside the city gates?... (suddenly grabs Theodora by the hair) I_cannot wait any longer! I need you and I need you NOW! Theodora wrenches free -- Evanora keeps at it, keeps on h

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: What are you so frightened of! WHAT ARE YOU HOLDING ON TO! He doesn’t love you! He will never love you! He is coming here to KILL you! Once again THE DIAMOND DAGGER magically appears in her ha she savagely stabs it into the table, embedding the blade the wood.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: The time has come -- you must ACCEPT the Evil inside of you! You must EMBRACE THE HATE! Theodora -- eyes on the Dagger -- finally shrieks --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: ALRIGHT! Stop it! -- alright! -- I'll do it... Evanora suppresses a smile -- crooks a finger --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Come. INT. GRAND DINING ROOM - EVANORA’S PALACE - MOMENTS LATER Theodora’s seated at the table -- staring -- as Evanora D POTION from a vial on a SHINY RED APPLE -- drop by drop..

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Will it hurt?  76.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Fleetingly. Then you'll never feel pain again.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Nor love.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: What good has love ever done you? What good has good ever done you? (the apple’s ready) There now. One bite is all it takes. One bite, and the world will change forever... one bite, and you'll be able to fly... one bite -- or Glinda will soon be seated on the Emerald Throne -- as_ the Wizard's Blessed Queen... That does it: Theodora snatches up the apple, takes a sav bite, and almost immediately it begins: THEODORA’S TRANSFORMATION A violent inner upheaval -- the sudden shock and pain of flashing across her face -- she PUSHES BACK FROM THE TABL hand to her chest -- CONVULSING -- shrieking --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: WHAT’S HAPPENING TO ME!

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: (soothingly) That’s only what’s left of your heart... withering away. Soon, my pretty, you’ll feel nothing at all except... beautiful wickedness. Theodora’s gasping, fighting for air -- face and body contorted -- she sinks to the floor -- hunched over -- fo in on herself -- face hidden -- her breathing slows, then

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Oh yes... yes... now I understand. And as she lifts her face we see: Her CHIN has lengthened her NOSE has hooked and grown... and HER SKIN HAS TURNED COMPLETELY GREEN -- and she has become:

dialogues.speaker: THE WICKED WITCH OF THE WEST
dialogues.text: She sees her hand -- sees the color -- feels her nose and chin -- goes to the Mirror on the Wall... gazes at hersel  77.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: A simple enchantment can have you looking just the way you were... if you want.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: No. This is me now. She whirls around -- lurches to the window -- flings it o -- orders the SAVAGE GENERALS waiting in the courtyard be

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Keep only enough of you here to protect the Palace and the Queen. The rest of you: You will exterminate the Wizard's Army -- but leave the Wizard himself for me! Now go -- GO!

dialogues.speaker: WHIMSIE GENERAL
dialogues.text: But... who are you? A beat -- then Theodora CACKLES -- proudly proclaims --

dialogues.speaker: OF THE WEST
dialogues.text: The Generals storm off, as --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Hurry, Wizard -- I want to dance with you again -- a different dance this time -- a wedding dance... I got married, you see -- to Wickedness -- and from now on: The bride will wear only black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAVAGE ARMY thunders out of the city -- Gnomes, Whims Growleywogs, Winged Monkeys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Savages flood onto the Great Plain -- fanning out -- then, look out, here it comes -- GLINDA’S STORM -- A ROLLING, BILLOWING WALL OF WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It SLAMS into the Savage Army -- with shrieking winds -- slashing ice and snow -- the Winged Monkeys are flung fro the sky like rag dolls -- and all the Savage Army can do hunker down right where they are -- huddled together -- s they're covered, mounded in snow, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodora fights to shut the window against the wind -- finally gets it closed -- wheels to face her sister --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Look at you -- calm as a clam.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: A storm like this is no easy task, even for a Sorceress as powerful as Glinda. The longer it lasts...

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: -- the weaker she’1l become --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: And when it ends we'll get to see what kind of a Wizard this Wizard really is... if he’s the Wizard everyone says he is...

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: You don’t believe, Sister?

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: I believe we shall see. EXT. WITH OZ’S ARMY - IN THE EYE OF THE STORM - EARLY EVE Oz is watching Glinda closely -- and the Sisters were rig The storm has clearly weakened her. Oz glances at Kala.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: We're here. And as the wall of snow in front of us recedes we see:

dialogues.speaker: A PYRAMID OF ROCKS
dialogues.text: A jumble of boulders fifty feet high.  79.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: The Caves are under there? How do we get in?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Magic. -- looking to Glinda -- and she summons up the last of he strength, circles her hand in the air, and... THE STORM WALLS START CLOSING IN ON THEM -- narrowing and lifting to form a spiralling FUNNEL overhead -- Glinda directs this snaky funnel over to the Pyramid -- to one particular HUGE BOULDER -- and THE FUNNEL PICKS IT UP AND WHISKS IT AWAY just like Dorothy’s Farmhouse, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MOUTH OF THE CAVES. Oz, impressed, turns to complimen Glinda, just as her eyes roll up in her head -- Oz leaps his horse, CATCHES GLINDA AS SHE FALLS -- passed out. THE STORM IS OVER. Night’s falling fast. Oz carries Glind into the Caves, while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Storm has ended here, too -- the Savages are digging themselves out of the snow -- a GNOME GENERAL is saying -

dialogues.speaker: GNOME GENERAL
dialogues.text: Let’s get some fires going. We’1l camp here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torchlight reveals: A SUBTERRANEAN WONDERLAND -- a vast central cavern -- towering stalactites and stalagmites -- underground river -- tunnels stretching into the darkness

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: The tunnels, they go all the way under the Impassable Desert right into the Savage Lands.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (still holding Glinda) So that’s how the Savages got here.

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Evanora, she brought them in -- to help her fight-fight Glinda’s father. He’s the one who closed the Caves, just before he died.  80.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: How did he die?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: I thought you knew. He died saving Glinda. Evanora, she killed him. (then) Come-come, we find a place to lay her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oz gently sets Glinda down inside it.

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: They were friends, you know -- Glinda and Evanora... and Evanora, she used that friendship, used Glinda’s goodness to trick-trick and trap her, because she knew that Glinda’s Father the King would do everything in his power to save her... and that’s when Evanora, she struck like a snake. Glinda, she saw her father die.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Killed by her friend. (echoes Theodora) She had no idea how wicked wickedness could be, or how easily friendship could be betrayed. (then) How long will she sleep?

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don’t try to waky- wake her with a kiss. We need you, Wizard.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (a quizzical look, then) Let’s get everyone ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks fly as, one by one, Scissors, Knives and Cleavers up to hone their blades against live spinning Whetstones.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CLEAVER
dialogues.text: Next! -- let’s go! -- look sharp!  81. Oz passes by -- and a little further on we see: TWO HAMMERHEADS -- HARASSING A PAPER SOLDIER -- using their breaths to huff and puff him back and forth between them.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: C’mon, boys, leave him alone. The Hammerheads scowl, but stop. Kala appears.

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: The Munchkins, they are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERALD CITY MUNCHKINS -- Glinda and Kala’s inside guys - are helping the Smith & Tinker Elves load their stuff ont small wagons and carts, pulled by MINIATURE HORSES. Oz an Kala are with the main MUNCHKIN, who’s named M.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: We’re counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: M. MUNCHKIN
dialogues.text: And the Good People of Oz are counting on you. Both smile, shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: See you in Emerald City. (then --) What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: M. MUNCHKIN
dialogues.text: Nothing, just... thought you’d be bigger. -- and this from a guy about three feet tall -- and as he climbs on his tiny horse he says --

dialogues.speaker: M. MUNCHKIN
dialogues.text: The others will be here before first light. The Munchkins and the Elves start out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still asleep -- then her eyes butterfly open -- she sees sitting nearby -- he’s been watching her sleep. He smiles  82.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You're awake.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: And restored.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: We're ready whenever you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oz stands with arms as extended, as those freshly-sharpen Scissors and Knives and Cleavers climb up his legs and to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and_settle themselves in -- in his belt -- in his pockets he’s soon sheathed in steel, bristling with blades -- oth honed Utensils are loading themselves onto Kala -- still others are stepping into a rucksack -- which Oz loops ove his shoulders -- then he looks to Glinda --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Let’s do it.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Step closer. Oz does -- Glinda makes a little motion with her hand -- the two of them are enveloped by THE MAGIC BUBBLE -- 0Z -- INSIDE THE BUBBLE -- marveling -- excited --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Sure beats a broomstick doesn’t it? THE MAGIC BUBBLE AND KALA FLY OFF, to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERLOOKING THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT. The Savage Army is asle a grunting, snoring, wheezing, scratching, mumbling sleep Then we see, coming out of the night sky to the south: THE MAGIC BUBBLE -- AND KALA. They land on the ridge overlooking the encampment, then head down the hill with and the Knives and Scissors and Cleavers -- INTO THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT -- where quickly, quietly, the Utensils climb off Oz and Kala and out of the rucksack, a they all get to work CLIPPING AND CHOPPING OFF THE GNOMES BEARDS -- AND SLICING THE MASKS OFF THE WHIMSIE WARRIORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we get our first look at the Whimsies real heads -- a they really are just appallingly, embarrassingly small. O and Glinda and Kala keep snipping and shearing, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before dawn. Oz and Glinda and Kala return with the Utensils -- Mission Accomplished, safe and sound -- to fi MUNCHKINS have arrived with MINIATURE MUNCHKIN HORSE-DRAW HAY WAGONS AND OX CARTS. Cuttenclip Soldiers are marching out of the Cave and loading themselves onto the carts and wagons -- laying themselves flat, one on top of the other that hundreds can be stacked together and still only be a high as a couple of reams of paper. The Munchkin teamster then COVER THEM UP WITH HAY. We also see: THE FUDDLES and THE HAMMERHEADS are ready to move out together. Oz shakes Farnsworth Fuddle’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Safe journey. Keep yourselves together, men! (then, to the Hammerheads) And you boys, use your heads! Give ‘em what-for! The Army starts out -- the Hammerheads and Fuddles headin west -- the Munchkins heading north with the hay-hidden P Soldiers. Then Glinda closes her eyes -- like she’s receiving a transmission of some kind -- then she smiles

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Elves have made it safely into the Emerald City.

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: And look-look. Behind the eastern hills: The first glimmer of dawn. EXT. THE GREAT PLAIN OF OZ - THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT — SAME And as the Savage Army starts to awaken, we start to hear AN UNGODLY HOWLING -- a great wailing and gnashing of tee as Gnomes realize they've been barbered -- Whimsies see they've been E-mask-ulated -- and they’re horrified -- be themselves -- can’t deal -- and so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY RUN -- just go instant AWOL -- A MAD, MASS STAMPEDE collisions -- confusion -- Savages scattering in every direction -- as we hear a furious prolonged SCREECH and g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODORA comes running in -- now dressed head to toe in witchy black -- she heard the screech -- Evanora’s screec sees Evanora staring into the Crystal -- seething --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: The Gnomes -- the Whimsies -- they're fleeing -- they’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Glinda alone couldn’t have made them do that. The Wizard's Army, where are they!

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: I haven’t found them yet.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Soon as you do, you let me know. -- already on her way out, and we FOLLOW HER out to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she storms down the hall, she sees a Munchkin Maid, SWEEPING THE MARBLE FLOOR. Theodora snatches away the bro

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Give me that! He wanted a broom? I'll give him a broom, and sweep him to his doom! EXT. OUTSIDE EVANORA'’S PALACE THEODORA comes out -- and FLIES OFF ON HER BROOMSTICK -- grim, determined, focused -- a black bolt across blue sky M. MUNCHKIN AND THE MASTER ELF -- hidden -- watch her fro below -- then go back to their secret preparations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HAMMERHEADS AND FUDDLES have reached their destinatio  85.

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: Alright, everyone, spread out, and prepare yourselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANORA’s watching this all on her Crystal Ball --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Sister. The Enchanted Orchard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODORA has arrived to take charge of the Savage Army -- surrounded by Growleywogs and Nikko and the Winged Monkey she’s telepathically communicating with her sister -- the she whirls, orders Nikko and the Monkeys --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: To the Enchanted Orchard! Kill everyone you see! Go! (the Monkeys fly off) The rest of you: I want a line of sharpened steel between here and the Emerald City. The Growleywogs move out to form a Maginot Line across Central Oz. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLINDA frowns -- she senses -- knows --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Winged Monkeys are on their way to the Orchard. Oz nods -- exhales -- here we go -- D-Day’s about to begi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEEING: THE WINGED MONKEYS -- IN-COMING -- a dark cloud against the sky like a murder of evil crows.

dialogues.speaker: FARNSWORTH FUDDLE
dialogues.text: Brace yourselves, men! Hold firm and wait until they land! THE FUDDLES straighten their shoulders, stiffen their spi There’s no sign of the Hammerheads.  86. NIKKO AND THE WINGED MONKEYS SWOOP IN -- hit the ground running -- drawing short swords from their belts -- and w horrific simian shrieks they come charging at: THE FUDDLES -- WHO IMMEDIATELY ALL FALL TO PIECES -- ever man-jack among them just fragments and collapses, and -- THE WINGED MONKEYS ARE CONFUSED -- their primitive little brains weren’t expecting this -- and they warily come for and start pawing through the puzzle piles -- inspect them with ignorant frowns -- and then, now that all the Monkey are here on the ground -- THE HAMMERHEADS ATTACK -- spring out from behind the tree and start jackhammering the Monkeys with their Jack-in-th Box heads -- ping-ponging the primates between them -- th FUDDLES QUICKLY RE-ASSEMBLE AND JOIN THE FIGHT, and --

dialogues.speaker: THE HAMMERHEADS AND FUDDLES LAUNCH THE MONKEYS INTO THE T
dialogues.text: -- high up into the branches, snapping off leaves and twi and apples -- and the Trees don’t like that one bit, and start WHALING ON THE WINGED MONKEYS -- limbs and branches just hammering the hell out of them, and soon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MONKEYS ARE FINISHED -- every one of them TKO’ed. The Fuddles tie the Monkeys up. Victory is theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLINDA suddenly starts SMILING -- Oz sees it, and knows -

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: They did it? (off her nod) Now the Cuttenclips -- if they make it through. Her smile fades -- she shares his concern -- and we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: getting STOPPED by Growleywog Warriors. Some of the wagon are just waved on through -- others receive a rudimentary SEARCH -- which entails nothing more than a Growleywog jabbing his spear in the straw. Then they wave the Munchk on, and we END MONTAGE and go:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE POPPY FIELDS — AFTERNOON And it is a Sea of Scarlet Poppies -- poppies whose odor according to Baum, ‘so powerful that anyone who breathes falls asleep, and if the sleeper is not carried away from scent of the flowers he sleeps on and on forever.’ THE MUNCHKIN TEAMSTERS have halted a safe distance from t fields, remove the hay and straw from the carts. THE

dialogues.speaker: CUTTENCLIP PAPER SOLDIERS PEEL THEMSELVES OFF ONE ANOTHER
dialogues.text: DISEMBARK -- some of them sporting the rips and tears the received from the points of probing Growleywog spears. TH PAPER SOLDIERS MARCH INTO POSITION -- form into rows in f of the rolling red fields -- mightily impressive, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANORA sees this on her Crystal Ball, says --

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODORA cocks an ear -- receives Evanora’s silent messag shouts to the Growleywog Warriors nearby --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: To the Poppy Fields! Follow me! She hops on her broomstick -- takes off -- shoots down th line of Warriors -- spreading the word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLINDA's seeing this in her mind’s eye -- tells Oz --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Theodora and her Warriors are heading for the Poppy Fields.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Please don’t let there be a wind -- not yet --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: I won't. Oz glances at Kala -- who’s quiet, worried -- clearly whatever's about to happen is crucial to Oz’s plan...  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE PAPER SOLDIERS’ POV: First they see THEODORA on broomstick -- a black onrushing dot in the sky -- then th loping ARMY OF GROWLEYWOGS, spear-tips flashing in the su FROM THE GROWLEYWOGS’ POV: A countless number of blue- jacketed Cuttenclips in front of the red, red fields.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Just remember they can’t kill you. Now water those pretty red flowers -- with pretty red blood. THE GROWLEYWOG GENERAL turns, raises his spear, lets out guttural war-cry, snaps his spear down -- and THE GROWLEY LET FLY WITH A THOUSAND ARROWS. THE CUTTENCLIP SOLDIERS look up -- see this arrow-storm sizzling towards them -- the Cuttenclips stand their grou and_the arrows pass right through them -- not a single soldier falls, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODORA’s stunned -- What just happened? -- and --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) Now... And she puffs out her cheeks and BLOWS, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK INTO THE POPPIES -- so it looks like they’re retreat -- and the GROWLEYWOG WARRIORS GO CHARGING UP THE HILL -- whooping like banshees -- a sound to freeze the blood, an DEEPER IN THE POPPY FIELDS -- Glinda’s wind keeps flutter the Cuttenclips farther into the flowers -- and THEODORA senses something’s wrong -- and shrieks --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: NO! IT’S A TRICK! DON’T --! THE GROWLEYWOGS don’t listen -- blood lust high -- and _ full battle cry they set upon the Cuttenclips -- STABBING SLASHING -- RIPPING the Soldiers to shreds -- but then... poppies start working their narcotic magic...  89.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROWLEYWOG WARRIORS START DROPPING LIKE OPIATED FLIES
dialogues.text: soon every last one of them is in a deep, drugged sleep..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEODORA can’t believe it -- for the briefest little mome we see a flicker of fear -- then her eyes narrow --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Deftly done, Wizard -- and Glinda too, I’m sure. But you haven’t won yet -- far from it. See you at Emerald City -- my sister and I will be waiting... And she jets off on her broom, back to Emerald City, and

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Our turn now.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very dark night... SAVAGE GUARDSMEN patrol the gates -- GROWLEYWOG WARRIOR mans the ramparts above -- then he hea something, quickly wheels to his left to see: KALA -- ZOOMING THROUGH THE AIR TOWARDS HIM -- towards us fist cocked and: POW! -- Kala crunches a punch into the Growleywog's jaw, knocking him cold -- the Savage goes do in a heap, his spear clattering onto stone, and -- OTHER SAVAGE SENTRIES hear it, come racing to investigate see KALA -- who scampers -- on foot -- and THE SAVAGES GI CHASE -- and when the balustrade is clear... THE MAGIC BUBBLE wafts in -- OZ AND GLINDA have arrived i City -- but before they separate, Glinda smiles --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Welcome to your Destiny. And Oz is as honest as he’s ever been in his life --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I didn’t do this for Destiny. I did it for you.  90. Then quickly, he turns and goes -- Glinda gazing after hi then she pulls up the hood of her cloak, hiding her face cowl. She moves off, into the shadows, while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KALA’s still leading the Guards on a helluva chase, and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLINDA moves along the stone wall -- her hand against it then pauses as if she’s listening to something far beyond hearing -- and then... SHE STEPS THROUGH THE WALL -- just walks through solid stone, into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANORA’s on the Emerald Throne -- doesn’t even turn arou as Glinda silently materializes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: I've been expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Of course you have. You knew this day would come.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry -- am I supposed to be frightened? -- of you or this false Wizard of yours?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: False Wizard...?

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me you believe --

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: In him? As a matter of fact I do.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: You always were so gullible.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Yes, once upon a time I even believed in you.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: You believed in our friendship. And you believed that, deep down, there was some Good inside me... (sneers) You were foolish then, you’re foolish now -- too foolish, I think, to live. Wouldn’t you agree, Sister?

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Definitely. Glinda slowly turns -- and there’s Theodora.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: So good to see you again, Glinda.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Don’t you look lovely.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Yes, don’t I -- I’m sure your Wizard would say the same -- he did tell me green’s his favorite color.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Then I’m sure he’ll enjoy sitting on the Emerald Throne.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: You mean my throne.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: I mean my father’s throne. Oz the Great and Powerful will be sitting there by morning.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: (cackles ) The Great and Powerful --?!

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Just you wait -- you'll see. Then, just as LIGHTNING flashes from Theodora’s fingers, Glinda abruptly VANISHES INTO THIN AIR. Theodora scowls..

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: What if she’s right? What if the Wizard is --?  92.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: -- he’s not -- as will be proved to you by morning -- for by morning he’1l be dead.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: That's a pity. I wanted to kill him slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips around a corner -- sees, up ahead, in the shadow M. MUNCHKIN -- gesturing: This way -- but then --

dialogues.speaker: THERE HE IS
dialogues.text: Oz wheels, sees: SIX WINKIE GUARDSMEN... M. Munchkin quic slips back into his hiding place as the Guardsmen advance Oz -- spears raised -- the steel circle closing -- Oz see escape -- so, thinking fast --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: There who is?

dialogues.speaker: WINKIE GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: You, Wizard. -- spear-points now inches from 0z, who somehow laughs --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Wizard? Me? I’m not the Wizard! And the Guardsmen hesitate...

dialogues.speaker: WINKIE GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Yes you are -- sure you are.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: How could I be? Gentlemen: Look at me! I’m just a man, and haven’t you heard? The Wizard of Oz is ten feet tall -- he breathes smoke and fire -- he is by all accounts and by any stretch of the imagination --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that’s as far as he gets, because: SUDDENLY THE WINKI GUARDSMEN ALL COLLAPSE TO THE FLOOR -- their bodies seem just disappear, leaving behind a jumble of hats and cloak and spears, then... RATS START WRIGGLING OUT FROM UNDER T MUDDLE -- the transformed Winkie Guardsmen -- courtesy of GLINDA -- to whom a greatly relieved Oz says --  93.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Thought you’d never get here. Come on! M. Munchkin reappears -- Oz and Glinda follow him into th shadows, as we start to hear: THE TOLLING OF A BELL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KALA’'S RINGING THE BELL -- hauling on the rope like a cr Quasimodo -- barricaded here in this tower while, outside the SAVAGE GUARDS TRY TO BREAK DOWN THE DOOR. And as the bell continues to loudly Ding and Dong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CITIZENS OF EM CITY come out of their houses -- wonde what all the commotion’s about, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAVAGES successfully smash the door down -- Kala flie out the tower window -- safely away, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE EM CITY CITIZENS gather in the Central Square... SAVA PALACE GUARDS keep them well back from the Palace, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASTER ELF is peering out.

dialogues.speaker: OZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Close the curtain. The Elf turns, and we see: Oz -- standing inside a circle very strange-looking CAMERA DEVICES. He says to Glinda --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Let’s begin. Glinda gives a sharp wave of her hand, and just like that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the torches in the city go out.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glinda pulls the cowl back over her head, smiles at Oz.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Ad_ astra per aspera.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: E Pluribus Unum. Glinda heads out -- Oz says to the Master Elf --

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRY-ICE SMOKE starts billowing in from all sides -- huggi the ground -- prompting murmurs from the crowd... then: f

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE ARCH OF TRIUMPH
dialogues.text: And even before the smoke clears we hear -- booming, amplified -- like the Voice of God Himself...

dialogues.speaker: DO NOT FEAR...
dialogues.text: And then, under the Arch -- we see it -- see him: A LARGE THAN-LIFE HOLOGRAM OF 0Z -- spectral, see-through --

dialogues.speaker: WIZARD OF OZ
dialogues.text: GEYSERS OF FIRE shoot up on either side of the Hologram.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We are here... EVANORA AND THEODORA -- ON THE PALACE BALCONY. Theodora flicks a hand -- the TORCHES next to them REIGNITE.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: And we are anxious to see just how Great and Powerful you truly are. Theodora signals -- and the PALACE GUARDSMAN RUSH THE HOLOGRAM -- SHOOTING ARROWS and FLINGING SPEARS -- which harmlessly pass right through the Image of Oz -- and when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spears and arrows hit the floor...  95. GLINDA -- in her shawl -- gestures -- AND THE SPEARS AND ARROWS TRANSFORM INTO SNAKES -- and go slithering off int the shadows... THE HOLOGRAM LAUGHS WITH SCORN.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd prefer this! And suddenly: THERE’S FIREBALL IN HER HAND -- which she heaves at the Hologram -- the fireball EXPANDING en route that when it hits it totally ENGULFS 0Z'S IMAGE -- turnin the space beneath the Arch INTO A CURTAIN OF FLAME -- the Citizens shrinking back from the light and the heat and -

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Oz motions to the Master Elf -- Cut! -- then steps up clo to a single, larger camera-type device, and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CENTRAL SQUARE
dialogues.text: When the Fireball dies out we see... Oz’s Image is gone. There’s nothing there under the Arch any longer. THE WICK SISTERS CACKLE -- triumphant -- but only for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Oz signals -- the Master Elf flicks a switch, and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CENTRAL SQUARE
dialogues.text: Another terrific BOOOOOM! of smoke and fire erupts under Arch -- and this time when the clouds clear we see:

dialogues.speaker: QZ'S FACE
dialogues.text: Like the face Dorothy will see when she goes to see the Wizard years from now -- and THE MOON FACE starts to grow gets BIGGER and BIGGER... then it starts FLOATING UP into air... and as it rises, in a voice like rolling thunder -

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Doubt you? -- I DEFY you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it begins... first a single streak of light zips across the sky like a meteor... then two more... then thr zip, zip, zip... then more and more and more -- crissing crossing, slashing the sky, then all at once -- It all stops. Theodora and Evanora exchange a look -- Was that it? -- but then... 0Z’S MOON FACE CHUCKLES... then

dialogues.speaker: BEHOLD
dialogues.text: AND THE SKY SEEMS TO EXPLODE! And, as Oz himself would probably say it, what follows is: ‘A FIREWORKS FANTASIA M

dialogues.speaker: SPECTACULAR AND STUPENDOUS THAN ANY THE WORLD HAS EVER SE
dialogues.text: And no one in Em City has ever seen anything remotely lik -- it’s eye-goggling and mind-boggling -- the Fourth of J times fifty -- and, as Oz had predicted -- THE PALACE GUARD SAVAGES -- terrified -- run like rats fr burning barn -- break ranks and high-tail it for the hill

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: (shrieks to Theodora) Do something! THEODORA turns -- then ZAPS A STEADY STREAM OF LIGHTNING her fingertips into 0z’s Holographic Moon Face -- and THE MOON FACE LAUGHS at her -- then BOOMS to the crowd --

dialogues.speaker: THE WEAKNESS OF WICKEDNESS
dialogues.text: And we can tell: All this zapping is sapping Theodora’s strength. The lightning first dims -- then fades out completely -- and she slumps against the railing.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Sister?  97. GLINDA -- DOWN BELOW -- IN THE SHADOWS - smiles to hersel then THRUSTS her hand up and forward -- and _some great shimmering PULSE OF ENERGY flashes up to the balcony -- T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SURGE SLAMS INTO THE SISTERS -- knocks Evanora clear thro the doorway -- she goes sliding on her backside along the floor -- her hair awry -- animal fear in her eyes for the very first time -- THEODORA’s still on the balcony -- on hands and knees -- the Sisters lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: We must leave.

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: The night is his. We leave and there will be other nights. THEODORA’s wavering -- then a ROMAN CANDLE slams into the Palace wall right beside her -- EXPLODES IN A SUPERNOVA O RED, WHITE AND BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: HIDDEN SMITH
dialogues.text: she’s being bombarded -- rockets and Roman Candles strafi the Palace walls -- she has to duck and cover -- snarling with rage -- shrieks towards 0z’s Moon Face --

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: THIS ISN’T OVER, WIZARD! Mark my words: You will watch each other die! She runs into the Palace, helps her Sister to her feet -- the two Wicked Witches beat a hasty retreat down the hall INT. THEODORA’S ROOM Theodora grabs her broomstick, flings open the window. Lo back -- Evanora’s just standing there -- looks devastated

dialogues.speaker: EVANORA
dialogues.text: Curse them -- curse them all.

dialogues.speaker: THEODORA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, Sister, we will. All in good time. Evanora nods -- regally walks past Theodora to the window raises her arms, the long folds of her sleeves spreading wings -- then SHE TAKES OFF -- soaring like a nighthawk - THEODORA SAILS AFTER HER -- ON HER BROOM --—  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kala sees the Wicked Sisters flying away -- has a TRUMPET looped on a strap -- he BLARES A TANTARA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hears it. The fireworks stop. The tantara continues -- a fanfare of victory -- and THE CELEBRATION BEGINS -- like an explosion -- an outpouring of utter joy Kala flaps down off the spire, and --

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Kala rushes in -- charged up -- Monkey-laughing --

dialogues.speaker: KALA
dialogues.text: We did it, Wizard -- you did it! The Wicked Witches: Gone-gone! Oz beams -- Glinda steps through the curtain -- all aglow

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: You were wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s me: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. He sweeps her into his arms, is about to kiss her, when -

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: What are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I was... trying to kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But I’m a Witch.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Believe me, I’ve kissed worse.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: But... my kiss would kill you. A searching beat -- then he sets her down.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: You mean... kill me kill me? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: compos mentis, kill me dead?  99. She nods -- Kala does, too -- it’s true...

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Not even one tiny kiss?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Much as I might like to, Wizard, I prefer you alive -- as do the Good People of Oz. Her smile’s bittersweet -- Oz shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Ain’t that a kick in the pants? Kala nods -- yes-yes -- and we go -- EXT. EMERALD CITY -— FOLLOWING DAY A GLORIOUS CELEBRATION IS IN FULL SWING. There’s a PARADE MARCHING BANDS -- DANCING IN THE STREETS. And we see: THE HAMMERHEADS -- who now have their arms and hands back -- strutting along, some clasping their hands over their hea like middleweight champs, others shaking hands with every

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: within reach -- including THE DAINTY CHINA MAYOR -- the o whose arm Oz snapped off -- who’s with his daughter the Dainty China Girl -- and no longer are they Dainty China they've been restored to flesh and blood, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STAGE has been erected -- crowded with VIP's -- a MUNCH DIGNITARY is at the podium proclaiming --

dialogues.speaker: MUNCHKIN DIGNITARY
dialogues.text: No one who was here last night will ever forget it -- Such wizardry! Such wonder! What a whiz of a Wiz our Wizard was! So sound the bells, Ding Dong, Ding Dong, the Wicked old Witches are gone! A CHEER goes up -- MUSIC PLAYS -- TOWER BELLS start to RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oz has stuffed his satchel full of about A GAZILLION DOLL WORTH OF GEMS AND JEWELS. But then... he HEARS the Bells, hears the Citizens break out in song, and he goes to the window, peeks through the curtain -- sees the Celebration the laughing and singing and dancing, then --  100.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Ready, Wizard? Oz spins, startled -- didn’t hear her come in. Then...

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I’m not going. I’m not leaving Oz. I can’t. Glinda holds her breath -- and waits.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: If I did, you know what would happen here.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: The Wicked Sisters would no doubt return, and could well reclaim the Emerald Throne.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: And I can’t let that happen. I won't. The People need a Wizard and I'll be their Wizard -- I’1l be the Wizard of Oz. The answer Glinda had hoped for -- and expected -- she gl

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Wizard.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Yeah: Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: (sweeps an arm) Your People await you. But Oz just shakes his head, glumly.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: No. I can’t do that, either. If I go down there the Good People of Oz will see me for what I really am: A common, ordinary man.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: Wizard, you are neither common nor ordinary.  101.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Nor am I a Great and Powerful Wizard -- and that’s what the People need me to be -- what they need to believe me to be... they need a Myth, not a man -- which is why I can never again let them see the real me... I’ve got to keep up the Illusion -- I’ve got to stay Behind the Curtain...

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: It will get lonely there.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: I know. (looks at her) I’m sure you know it, too.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: I do -- all too well.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: (another moment, then) I need a pen and some paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KALA comes out of the Palace, clutching a piece of parchm He marches towards the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0Z AND GLINDA are at the window, watching from behind a curtain when, suddenly: there’s A SOUND LIKE A SONIC BOOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops, looks up and sees, SLASHING ACROSS THE SK THEODORA AND EVANORA -- ON BROOMSTICKS -- burning broomst -- trailing BLACK SMOKE -- SKYWRITING the words...

dialogues.speaker: JUST YOU WAIT
dialogues.text: THE CITIZENS exchange nervous glances, nervous murmurs -- THEODORA AND EVANORA finish -- and zoom away -- Theodora leaving behind one last wicked CACKLE... after they’re go Silence -- uncertainty -- then --  102. ON THE STAGE -- Kala prods the Munchkin Dignitary -- who steps to the podium and cries:

dialogues.speaker: MUNCHKIN DIGNITARY
dialogues.text: Good People of Oz! I have here a missive from the Great Wizard himself! And I quote... (reads from the parchment) ‘As your Wizard I hereby decree that henceforth and hereafter the Land of Oz will forever be Free!’ A GREAT CHEER -- the MUSIC and DANCING start up again, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0Z AND GLINDA gaze down at the revelers...

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn’t a dream.

dialogues.speaker: GLINDA
dialogues.text: It’s no dream.

dialogues.speaker: OZ
dialogues.text: Good. I don’t want to wake up and find out none of this is really real -- ‘cause y’know something? (turns and smiles) There’s no place like Oz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CELEBRATION continues -- but for us we’ve reached... THE END.
